runs.comm: nice length to start with, just outside off and van Wyk lets it go
fuller and wider, there's outswing too, and van Wyk flashes at that to take the aerial route. It falls a bit before third man for one
draws Amla's outside edge with a teasing line outside off, Amla pushes at it with hard hands and finds one to third man
shapes it away a bit from van Wyk, he shoulders arms again
bangs it shorter outside off, van Wyk pulls and misses as the ball goes under his bat. Slightly scrambled seam
jabs it in from back of length using the angle, it deflects off the pad towards backward point and they scamper for one
back of length and angling in towards the batsman at 144.5kph, tucked to fine leg for one
runs this one intentionally by opening the face of the bat late to third man for one
accurate length with good speed outside off, he pokes and misses on the front foot as the ball just holds its line and beats him
short ball touch wider outside off, he pulls and misses again
even shorter now outside off, van Wyk sways out of the line this time
143.4kph, angles the bouncer in towards the head, van Wyk just sways out of the line by bending his back backwards
full and outside off, sliced drive wide of backward point
shortish and on off, Van Wyk attempts a pull and drags it behind square off an inside edge
back of a length and jags back in off the seam to zip past the inside edge. Amla, perhaps, aimed to drive on the rise and did not connect
too full and straight, glanced to the left of short fine leg. Amla beats long leg as well. First four of the chase
width on offer outside off, Amla flashes and edges it thickly over lone slip for back-to-back fours
shortish and outside off, Amla loads up for a cut and ends up chopping it behind to the keeper off a bottom edge
top, stop strike. One-bounce four. Good length and outside off, Van Wyk comes forward and lifts it over the covers
back of a length and swerves in, Van Wyk nearly chops it back on. He edges it onto the ground, the ball lobs over the off stump
MM digs it short and wide outside off, Van Wyk latches onto it as he pulls it behind square on the leg side
this one is even better. Fuller and outside off, he extends his arms and launches it over cover- point area after opening the face of the bat. Van Wyk sends it clattering over the boundary
swerving in on the pads, diverted to short fine leg
back of a length and on off, Amla shuffles across and nurdles a single to leg
back of a length and around off, flicked neatly through backward square leg
143.7ks, back of a length, angled in and then leaves Van Wyk, who was prodding. Beaten by the away movement off the seam
fuller and on a leg-stump line, knocked in front of midwicket for one
full and outside off, Amla glides it to third man after opening the face
back of a length and angled in at 148ks, pressed to mid-off
wide line outside off, slashed over to third man

Worker juggles and takes it on the rebound as Bracewell strikes with his first ball. Pitched up around off, Van Wyk wants to punt it over the covers. He does not get hold of it as he slices it into the air. Worker at backward point hangs on. The second grab does it
on a length and outside off, driven to backward point
full and on off and middle, wristily driven to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Amla punches it sweetly but can't thread the packed off-side field
length and outside off, AB watches it through to the keeper
full and wide outside off, AB wades into it. One-handed smash between cover-point and backward point. Perfect square-drive
starts off with an off-side wide
flatter and turns away outside off, Amla cracks it wide of backward point off the back foot. Mile slides in the deep but can only deflect it back to the boundary, instead of swatting the ball in
punched out to deep cover
patted to the covers
driven from outside off to long-on
tossed up, blocked back to the bowler
Worker gives this more air outside off. Overpitched. AB bends his knees and loft-drives it over extra-cover. Lovely strike..
flighted on off from round the stumps, nudged towards the square-leg umpire
full and straight, flicked through midwicket
flat and on middle, picked away to the right of short midwicket
fired on middle, AB hunts for a reverse-paddle and mis-hits it as it goes only far as third man
N Mac shortens his length, whip-punched away behind square on the leg side
length and on off, eased to long-on. Amla wants two and they get it
back of a length and angled across off, Amla, having shuffled away, dabs it down to third man
back of a length and angled in, AB manages an inside edge onto the pad. The pair hustle across for a single. MM loses his balance and collapses on the floor, he can't flick it back onto the stumps
dug in short and wide outside off, slapped away towards deep cover
MM bangs it short and outside off, AB swat-pulls it away to the right of mid-on and hits the cow-corner boundary
AB races down the track, MM ventures even shorter and lets it fly through to the keeper. Second bouncer of the over; no ball called
back of a length and on off, AB swings it hard. Worker, I guess, runs in from mid-on, dives forward, but the ball drops short of him
fullish and on middle, Amla shuffles across off and misses the flick. Off the pad and Ronchi takes it. No snick, though
down the track and driven down to long-on
full and on off, which is sliced behind point
picked away off the pads through backward square leg
precise placement, AB splits deep midwicket and long-on. Fuller and on middle and leg, whipped away
dragged to the leg side. Not off the middle of the bat
N Mac spears it flat and outside off, AB comes down the track and drills it to long-off
encore! Darted short on off, AB goes deep in the crease and unleashes a pull between deep midwicket and long-on
full and just a shade outside off, slapped to the covers
turn and bounce. Slower through the air, swing and a miss
lobbed up outside off, extra bounce. AB adjusts and forces it over the covers
Worker takes down AB. Big, big wicket for NZ. Dug in short and outside off, AB hits a pull, does well, but holes out to deep midwicket, where N Mac dives forward and pouches it
back of a length and turns in, punched down to long-on
shortish and outside off, Rossouw leans back and cuts it towards sweeper cover
pushed through on off, worked in front of square for one
short again, slapped to short cover, where Williamson flings to his right and makes a smart save
inside-edges a single to the leg side
straight roller, pushed back to the bowler
full and on middle, driven back to N Mac
shortish and outside off, punched to backward point
back of a length and outside off, punchily driven to the right of sweeper cover
109.3ks, slowy ball on middle and leg, flicked to long-on
back of a length and rises on off, check-pushed it to short cover
good length and outside off, Rossouw aims to flick over the leg side. He closes the face early and loops it over Williamson at cover off a leading edge
a bit fuller and outside off, Rossouw loads up and lustily clubs it over long-on
short offbreak, dragged to deep midwicket
Williamson errs short again as Rossouw ventures deep in the crease and pulls it away to cow corner
slog-swept away to backward square leg
flatter on middle and leg, jammed to midwicket
quicker through the air and outside off, stabbed to the covers
Amla steps out, meets the pitch and knocks a single down to long-on
lifter outside off, Amla, who shuffles around in the crease, can't ramp it over the keeper
back of a length and climbs over the stumps as Amla cuts and misses
Amla steps across the off stump and is surprised by this skiddy, short ball. He looks to pull and flaps it to the right of midwicket
shortish and on a fourth-stump line, mistimed pull to mid-on
beats mid-off to his left. Rossouw skips down the track, meets the pitch and drills a fierce drive after meeting it on the half-volley
bumper from Milne, loads of height on it as it sails through to Ronchi. Wide called
140.6ks bouncer, Rossouw seeks to pull and top-edges it over long leg. Rossouw was a bit late onto the stroke
down the track and flipped to the right of midwicket
fuller and on middle and leg, swung away to long-on
pushed through on middle, full again. Amla takes a step forward, winds up and whacks it over long-on after clearing his front leg
an appeal for lbw. Not given. Darted quick, Amla comes down and takes it on the pad. He misses the slog sweep
punched down to long-on
shortish and sliding across off, cut away past short third man to bring up the fifty partnership
Rossouw nips down the track, he wants to swipe it over leg. Ends up top-edging it over a leaping Ronchi. MM collapses in his followthrough
Rossouw comes down the track again, flat-bats it over the covers, mid-off had no chance
too full and wide outside off, Rossouw can't slice it away
141ks, top edged and gone! Lifting, short ball slanted across off. Rossouw seeks to pull and skews it. Ronchi pedals back and swallows it. The change of angle does it..
fuller and speared on off, Amla shuffles across, misses the flick and takes it on the pad. Pitched in line. The tracker shows that it would have hit the top of off
straight in line, tucked down to long leg
back of a length, slants in and hits Miller on the pad before wandering away behind square on off
Amla comes down the track, Mile is wary of it as he bangs in a short ball. Amla can only top edge the hook to Latham at deep midwicket
short ball on middle, pulled to long leg for one
141.8ks, short and wide outside off, slapped to backward point. Looked like it did not carry to Guptill

South Africa open their home season with a six-wicket win. Shorter and wider outside off at 146.7ks, Behardien flashes a cut, this time over backward point and puts the seal on South Africa's victory..
